content:
Certainly! Here are some examples of poems by Langston Hughes and Maya Angelou that touch on the themes I mentioned:

1. Identity:

- "Theme for English B" by Langston Hughes
- "Still I Rise" by Maya Angelou
- "I Too, Sing America" by Langston Hughes
- "Phenomenal Woman" by Maya Angelou

2. Resistance:

- "Harlem" by Langston Hughes
- "Caged Bird" by Maya Angelou
- "Let America Be America Again" by Langston Hughes

3. Joy and Love:

- "The Negro Speaks of Rivers" by Langston Hughes
- "Touched by An Angel" by Maya Angelou
- "Love Song for Lucinda" by Langston Hughes

4. Legacy:

- "Mother to Son" by Langston Hughes
- "When Great Trees Fall" by Maya Angelou
- "Dream Deferred" by Langston Hughes

These are just a few examples, as both poets have extensive bodies of work that touch on a range of themes.
